intro: Gymnocarpos mahranus, commonly known as the Mahran's burr, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Iran and Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It is well adapted to harsh, dry environments, with a deep root system to access water. Gymnocarpos mahranus is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in areas with minimal rainfall.
